comments.text:
+Tys Dasd i respect how civil you were about your comment, But I just need 
to tell you that being gay is not a choice, I know because I am gay. Now we 
may disagree but I just sincerly hope you understand that while the action 
of having gay sex or relashionships is a choice the attraction to the 
opposite sex is not... You can control if you have sex with a woman or not 
but you cant control if you think she is hot and you are attracted to 
her.... Neither can I. And like I said we may disagree but I just felt I 
needed to make this comment. I hope that if you continue your belief that 
it is a choice you can remain to be civil in these kind of situations and 
try not to change anyone who is gay... also try not to tell someone who is 
gay that they chose that... it is highly offensive and incorrect.

comments.author: optifog

comments.text:
Morals = compassion. Nothing whatsoever to do with sex. All compassion. If 
it has nothing to do with ending suffering, then it has nothing to do with 
morality. Taboos = irrational aversion to things that cause no harm 
whatsoever. It is insulting to the wonderful nature of morality, i.e. 
compassion, wanting the best for everybody, to equate it with silly taboos 
that have nothing to do with ending suffering and everything to do with 
irrational dislike of something.
comments.author: optifog

comments.text:
Being caring counts for nothing? Trying to make a difference to other 
people counts for nothing? What good will his bullies do to the world? 
Surely it would be much better if THEY were dead, because they cause others 
to suffer, whereas this boy would have continued to contribute to other 
people's lives positively, continued to give love. Being tough is worse 
than worthless, if you don't use your toughness to PROTECT others. Using it 
to hurt means the world would be better off without you.
comments.author: optifog
